pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:5.1: 7. The training rule on raw grain
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:6.2: At that time, during the harvest season, the nuns asked for raw grain and then carried it to town. At the town gate they were detained and told,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:7.1: They then went to the nuns’ dwelling place and told the nuns what had happened.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:7.2: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:7.4: “How can nuns ask for raw grain?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:7.5: “Is it true, monks, that nuns did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:7.8: “How can nuns ask for raw grain?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:7.9: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:7.10: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:8.1: ‘If a nun asks for or gets someone else to ask for raw grain, or she roasts it or gets it roasted, or she pounds it or gets it pounded, or she cooks it or gets it cooked, and she then eats it, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:15.1: If she accepts it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:15.2: For every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing confession.
